history.text: hi
hi
Our movie is The Post

The Post is a 2017 American historical political thriller film directed and produced by Steven
Spielberg and written by Liz Hannah and Josh Singer.
Yes, The Post.  Tom Hanks and Meryl Streep are in it

It stars Meryl Streep as Katharine Graham,
the first female publisher of a major American newspaper,

and Tom Hanks as Ben Bradlee, the
executive editor of The Washington Post, with Sarah Paulson, Bob Odenkirk, Tracy Letts, Bradley
Whitford, Bruce Greenwood, Carrie Coon, and Matthew Rhys in supporting roles.
This is set in the 1970s
Never a bad Spielberg movie
Yes
based on true events

Set in the early
1970s, The Post depicts the true story of attempts by journalists at The Washington Post to publish
the Pentagon Papers, classified documents regarding the 30-year involvement of the United
States government in the Vietnam War.
Yes, true events about the Vietnam War
It's more about a newspaper in the states, but it regards things that happened in the war that they reveal to the public
The movies sounds like there may be some suspense to it based on the journalists decisions
definately
1st key scene..
Rotten Tomatoes gives it 88%

In 1966 Vietnam, State Department military analyst Daniel Ellsberg accompanies U.S.
troops in combat, documenting the progress of U.S. military activities in the region for
Secretary of Defense Robert McNamara. On the return flight home, McNamara expresses
to Ellsberg and William Macomber his view that the war in Vietnam is hopeless, yet, upon
landing, McNamara expresses his confidence in the war effort. Ellsberg overhears this, and
becomes disillusioned. Years later, now working for the RAND Corporation, a civilian
military contractor, Ellsberg surreptitiously photocopies classified reports documenting the
country's decades-long involvement in the conflict in Vietnam, dating back to the Truman
administration. Ellsberg then leaks these documents to reporters at The New York Times.
and an A for Cinema Score
what's your favorite Speilberg movie?
There are quite a few great actors in The Post
Tom Hanks
Meryl Streep
Bob Odenkirk
Sarah Paulson
I like that this movie is a historical movie.
Yeah
He tends to split his time between historical pieces and more fantasy/scifi movies
he even releases 2 per year sometimes
Do you generally look at movie ratings?  This one is rated pretty well.
Yeah pretty high up there

Rotten Tomatoes: 88% and average: 7.9/10
2. Metacritic Score: 83/100
Anything over 70% is usually worth watching in my opinion
Agreed
are you familiar with Bob Odenkirk from Breaking Bad?
Yes, he is a good actor.  I like that he is in The Post.
Did you ever watch Mr. Show? It was a sketch show on HBO in the 90s.
Odenkirk was in that
I am not sure about that show but did you see that the court's decided to rule in favor of the newspaper and that Nixon wanted the Post barred from the White House?
Oh wow, i didn't see that
If you look at key scene #3.  Interesting.  It also mentions that the break-in at Watergate was one year later!
